intro: Vochysia sprucei, commonly known as the Brazil nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain the seeds, which are the edible Brazil nuts. It thrives in humid, lowland tropical forests and is an important component of the rainforest ecosystem. Vochysia sprucei plays a crucial role in supporting biodiversity and is also economically significant for its nut production.
